Operation 'ListMessage' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Filter all messages' is vague and doesn't indicate retrieval action. Description is verbose with formatting examples but lacks clarity on what is returned and pagination details. Improved version emphasizes the query/retrieve action, clarifies URL encoding requirement, and indicates the response contains message details, making it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Filter all messages to search your Email Activity. All queries must be [URL encoded](https://meyerweb.com/eric/tools/dencoder/), and use the following format:

`query={query_type}="{query_content}"`

 Once URL encoded, the previous query will look like this:

`query=type%3D%22query_content%22`

For example, to filter by a specific email, use the following query:

`query=to_email%3D%22example%40example.com%22`

Visit our [Query Reference section](https://docs.sendgrid.com/for-developers/sending-email/getting-started-email-activity-api#query-reference) to see a full list of basic query types and examples.
data.summary_suggestion: Query and retrieve filtered email messages
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of email messages from your Email Activity, filtered by query parameters. Supports complex queries using URL-encoded format (e.g., `query=to_email%3D%22example%40example.com%22`). Returns paginated results containing message details including status, timestamps, and recipient information. Refer to the Query Reference for available filter types and syntax.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Filter all messages' is vague and doesn't indicate retrieval action. Description is verbose with formatting examples but lacks clarity on what is returned and pagination details. Improved version emphasizes the query/retrieve action, clarifies URL encoding requirement, and indicates the response contains message details, making it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'GetMessage' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary uses 'Filter' which is imprecise for a single-message lookup operation. Description is too brief and doesn't specify what details are returned. Enhanced version clarifies this is a retrieval operation for a specific message, lists key returned fields relevant to email activity analysis, and mentions the required parameter for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Get all of the details about the specified message.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve detailed message information by ID
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves comprehensive details for a specific email message using its message ID. Returns complete message information including delivery status, recipient address, subject, timestamps, bounce type (if applicable), and all associated email events. Requires a valid message ID path parameter.
data.reasoning: Summary uses 'Filter' which is imprecise for a single-message lookup operation. Description is too brief and doesn't specify what details are returned. Enhanced version clarifies this is a retrieval operation for a specific message, lists key returned fields relevant to email activity analysis, and mentions the required parameter for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'RequestCsv' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary 'Request CSV' is too generic. Description is verbose and includes unnecessary comparison to other endpoints. Improved version clarifies this is an asynchronous operation, specifies the 202 response code and download UUID return value, consolidates the data scope and rate limit information, and emphasizes the query parameter compatibility for AI agents to understand how to construct requests.

data.current_description:
This request will kick off a backend process to generate a CSV file. Once generated, the worker will then send an email for the user download the file. The link will expire in 3 days.

The CSV will contain the events from the last 30 days, limited to the last 1 million events maximum. This endpoint will be rate limited to 1 request every 12 hours (rate limit may change).

This endpoint is similar to the GET Single Message endpoint - the only difference is that /download is added to indicate that this is a CSV download requests but the same query is used to determine what the CSV should contain.
data.summary_suggestion: Request asynchronous CSV export of email activity
data.description_suggestion: Initiates an asynchronous background process to generate a CSV export of email messages matching your query parameters. The CSV will contain email activity events from the last 30 days (maximum 1 million events). Upon completion, a download link is sent via email and remains valid for 3 days. Accepts the same query format as the List Messages endpoint. Rate limited to 1 request per 12 hours. Returns a 202 Accepted response with a download UUID for tracking the request.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Request CSV' is too generic. Description is verbose and includes unnecessary comparison to other endpoints. Improved version clarifies this is an asynchronous operation, specifies the 202 response code and download UUID return value, consolidates the data scope and rate limit information, and emphasizes the query parameter compatibility for AI agents to understand how to construct requests.

message: Operation 'DownloadCsv' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary 'Download CSV' is vague about the actual operation (retrieving a URL, not downloading the file itself). Description lacks context about the required download_uuid parameter and the relationship to the prior RequestCsv operation. Enhanced version clarifies this retrieves a presigned URL (not the file directly), specifies the required parameter, and explains the workflow dependency for better AI agent understanding of operation sequencing.

data.current_description: **This endpoint will return a presigned URL that can be used to download the CSV that was requested from the "Request a CSV" endpoint.**
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve presigned URL for CSV download
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a presigned URL for downloading the CSV file generated by a prior Request CSV operation. Requires the download_uuid returned from the Request CSV endpoint. The presigned URL provides temporary access to the generated CSV file containing email activity data. Use the download_uuid path parameter to identify which CSV export to retrieve.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Download CSV' is vague about the actual operation (retrieving a URL, not downloading the file itself). Description lacks context about the required download_uuid parameter and the relationship to the prior RequestCsv operation. Enhanced version clarifies this retrieves a presigned URL (not the file directly), specifies the required parameter, and explains the workflow dependency for better AI agent understanding of operation sequencing.
